df-upgr
blocks.content: Define the class of all undirected pseudographs. An (undirected) pseudograph consists of a set ` v ` (of "vertices") and a function ` e ` (representing indexed "edges") into subsets of ` v ` of cardinality one or two, representing the two vertices incident to the edge, or the one vertex if the edge is a loop. This is according to Chartrand, Gary and Zhang, Ping (2012): "A First Course in Graph Theory.", Dover, ISBN 978-0-486-48368-9, section 1.4, p. 26: "In a pseudograph, not only are parallel edges permitted but an edge is also permitted to join a vertex to itself. Such an edge is called a loop." (in contrast to a multigraph, see ~ df-umgr ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 24-Nov-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-upgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cupgr, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), wf(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s2)), crab(s3, cdif(cpw(cv(s1)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(s3)), cle, nat2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-umgr
blocks.content: Define the class of all undirected multigraphs. An (undirected) multigraph consists of a set ` v ` (of "vertices") and a function ` e ` (representing indexed "edges") into subsets of ` v ` of cardinality two, representing the two vertices incident to the edge. In contrast to a pseudograph, a multigraph has no loop. This is according to Chartrand, Gary and Zhang, Ping (2012): "A First Course in Graph Theory.", Dover, ISBN 978-0-486-48368-9, section 1.4, p. 26: "A multigraph M consists of a finite nonempty set V of vertices and a set E of edges, where every two vertices of M are joined by a finite number of edges (possibly zero). If two or more edges join the same pair of (distinct) vertices, then these edges are called parallel edges." To provide uniform definitions for all kinds of graphs, ` x e. ( ~P v \ { (/) } ) ` is used as restriction of the class abstraction, although ` x e. ~P v ` would be sufficient (see ~ prprrab and ~ isumgrs ). (Contributed by AV, 24-Nov-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-umgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cumgr, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), wf(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s2)), crab(s3, cdif(cpw(cv(s1)), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s3)), nat2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}

thm isupgr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ UPGraph ↔(c2 : dom(c2)→ { s0 ∈(P(c3)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 })))
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ UPGraph ↔(c2 : dom(c2)→ { s0 ∈(P(c3)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))), d(s0, c0))
  syl5bb(c0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ UPGraph, (c2 : dom(c2)→ { s0 ∈(P(c3)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }), c0 ∈ { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 })})
  eleq2i(c0, cupgr, { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 })})
  df-upgr(hs2, hs1, hs0, s0)
  elab2g(hs3, c0, c1, { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 })}, (c2 : dom(c2)→ { s0 ∈(P(c3)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→ { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))
  feq123d((iEdg ` hs3), dom((iEdg ` hs3)), { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }, c2, dom(c2), { s0 ∈(P(c3)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }, hs3 = c0)
  syl6eqr((iEdg ` hs3), c2, (iEdg ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  syl6eq(dom((iEdg ` hs3)), dom(c2), dom((iEdg ` c0)), hs3 = c0)
  dmeqd((iEdg ` hs3), (iEdg ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  fveq2(hs3, c0, ciedg)
  dmeqi((iEdg ` c0), c2)
  eqcomi((iEdg ` c0), c2)
  rabeqdv(s0, (P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ }), (P(c3)\ { ∅ }), hs3 = c0, (# ` s0)[≤]2)
  difeq1d(P((Vtx ` hs3)), { ∅ }, P(c3), hs3 = c0)
  pweqd((Vtx ` hs3), c3, hs3 = c0)
  syl6eqr((Vtx ` hs3), c3, (Vtx ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  fveq2(hs3, c0, cvtx)
  cbvabv(hs2, hs3, [(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→ { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))
  sbcied2(hs1, (Vtx ` hs2), universe, (Vtx ` hs3), hs2 = hs3, [(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→ { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))
  fvexd(cvtx, hs2, hs2 = hs3)
  fveq2(hs2, hs3, cvtx)
  sbcied2(hs0, (iEdg ` hs2), universe, (iEdg ` hs3), (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)), (hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→ { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))
  fvexd(ciedg, hs2, (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)))
  adantr(hs2 = hs3, hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3), (iEdg ` hs2)=(iEdg ` hs3))
  fveq2(hs2, hs3, ciedg)
  feq123d(hs0, dom(hs0), { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }, (iEdg ` hs3), dom((iEdg ` hs3)), { s0 ∈(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }, ((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3))∧ hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3)))

  difeq1d(P(hs1), { ∅ }, P((Vtx ` hs3)), ((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3))∧ hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3)))
  ad2antlr(hs2 = hs3, hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3), hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3), P(hs1)= P((Vtx ` hs3)))

  diff.cpw.s(s0, c3)

  diff.hs3.w([(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→ { s0 ∈(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })|(# ` s0)[≤]2 }))
  diff.hs1.c((Vtx ` hs2))
  diff.hs1.w(hs2 = hs3)

  diff.hs0.c((iEdg ` hs2))

  diff.cdif.s(s0, P(hs1), { ∅ })

blocks.name: wrdupgr
blocks.content: The property of being an undirected pseudograph, expressing the edges as "words". (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 10-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdupgr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cword(c3))), wb(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(c2, cword(crab(s0, cdif(cpw(c4), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), cle, nat2))))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cword(c3))), wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(c2, cword(crab(s0, cdif(cpw(c4), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), cle, nat2)))), wf(c2, cdm(c2), crab(s0, cdif(cpw(c4), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), cle, nat2))))

thm upgrss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {
  elpwid(cfv(c2, c1), c3, wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2))))
  sseldi(cfv(c2, c1), cpw(c3), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2))))
  sstri(crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), cpw(c3), cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)))
  ssrab2(hs0, cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))
  difss(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls))
  ffvelrnda(c1, cdm(c2), c2, crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), wcel(c0, cupgr))
  upgrf(hs0, c0, c2, c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}

blocks.content: The empty graph, with vertices but no edges, is a pseudograph. The empty graph is actually a simple graph, see ~ usgr0eop , and therefore also a multigraph ( ` G e. UMGraph ` ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 11-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: upgr1eop
blocks.content: A pseudograph with one edge. Such a graph is actually a simple pseudograph, see ~ uspgr1eop . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 10-Oct-2020.)

thm upgr1eop(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))), wcel(cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5)))), cupgr))
} = {
  upgr1e(cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5)))), cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))), c2, c3, c4, c5, wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))))
  simplr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0)))
  eleqtrrd(c4, cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))), c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))))
  simprl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))
  eleqtrrd(c5, cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))), c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))))
  simprr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0)), wceq(cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))), c0), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))), universe))
  opvtxfv(c0, c1, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))), universe)
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0)), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cop(c0, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))))), csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5)))), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))), universe))
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c4, c0), wcel(c5, c0)), wcel(csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))), universe))
  snex(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5)))
  opiedgfv(c0, c1, csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c5))), universe)
}

blocks.name: upgr0eopALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ upgr0eop , using the general theorem ~ gropeld to transform a theorem for an arbitrary representation of a graph into a theorem for a graph represented as ordered pair. This general approach causes some overhead, which makes the proof longer than necessary (see proof of ~ upgr0eop ). (Contributed by AV, 11-Oct-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm upgr0eopALT(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cop(c0, emptycls), cupgr))
} = {
  gropeld(hs0, c0, emptycls, cupgr, c1, universe, wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wal(hs0, wi(wa(wceq(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs0)), c0), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), emptycls)), wcel(cv(hs0), cupgr))))
  ax-gen(hs0, wi(wa(wceq(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs0)), c0), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), emptycls)), wcel(cv(hs0), cupgr)))
  upgr0e(cv(hs0), universe, wa(wceq(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs0)), c0), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), emptycls)))
  a1i(wa(wceq(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs0)), c0), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), emptycls)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  simpr(wceq(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs0)), c0), wceq(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  id(wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(emptycls, universe))
  0ex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs0.c(cupgr)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
}

blocks.name: upgrun
blocks.content: The union ` U ` of two pseudographs ` G ` and ` H ` with the same vertex set ` V ` is a pseudograph with the vertex ` V ` and the union ` ( E u. F ) ` of the (indexed) edges. (Contributed by AV, 12-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)

thm upgrun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cupgr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cupgr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cupgr))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c2), c5))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), c5))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cun(c3, c4)))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wcel(c0, cupgr), wf(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))))

  fun2d(c3, c4, cdm(c3), cdm(c4), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c3, cdm(c3), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))), wcel(c1, cupgr))
  upgrf(hs0, c1, c3, c5)
  mpbird(w0, wf(c4, cdm(c4), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))), wf(c4, cdm(c4), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))))
  syl(w0, wf(c4, cdm(c4), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))), wcel(c2, cupgr))
  upgrf(hs0, c2, c4, cfv(cvtx, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c2))
  feq3d(c4, cdm(c4), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), w0)
  rabeqdv(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls)), w0, wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))
  difeq1d(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls), cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), w0)
  pweqd(c5, cfv(cvtx, c2), w0)
  eqcomd(c5, cfv(cvtx, c2), w0)
  feq123d(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), cun(c3, c4), cun(cdm(c3), cdm(c4)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)), w0)
  syl6eq(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), cun(cdm(c3), cdm(c4)), cdm(cun(c3, c4)), w0)
  dmeqd(cfv(ciedg, c0), cun(c3, c4), w0)
  dmun(c3, c4)
  rabeqdv(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls)), w0, wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2))
  difeq1d(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls), cpw(c5), w0)
  pweqd(cfv(cvtx, c0), c5, w0)
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c0, cupgr), wf(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cle, nat2)))), wcel(c0, c6))
  isupgr(hs0, c0, c6, cfv(ciedg, c0), cfv(cvtx, c0))

thm upgrun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ UPGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ UPGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ UPGraph)
  ⊣ c3 =(iEdg ` c1)
  ⊣ c4 =(iEdg ` c2)
  ⊣ c5 =(Vtx ` c1)
  ⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c2)= c5)
  ⊣ (w0 →(dom(c3)⋂ dom(c4))= ∅)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c6)
  ⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c0)= c5)
  ⊣ (w0 →(iEdg ` c0)=(c3 ⋃ c4))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, c0 ∈ UPGraph, ((iEdg ` c0): dom((iEdg ` c0))→ { hs0 ∈(P((Vtx ` c0))\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }))
  mpbird(w0, ((iEdg ` c0): dom((iEdg ` c0))→ { hs0 ∈(P((Vtx ` c0))\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }), ((c3 ⋃ c4):(dom(c3)⋃ dom(c4))→ { hs0 ∈(P(c5)\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }))
  fun2d(c3, c4, dom(c3), dom(c4), { hs0 ∈(P(c5)\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }, w0)
  syl(w0, (c3 : dom(c3)→ { hs0 ∈(P(c5)\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }), c1 ∈ UPGraph)
  upgrf(hs0, c1, c3, c5)
  mpbird(w0, (c4 : dom(c4)→ { hs0 ∈(P(c5)\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }), (c4 : dom(c4)→ { hs0 ∈(P((Vtx ` c2))\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }))
  syl(w0, (c4 : dom(c4)→ { hs0 ∈(P((Vtx ` c2))\ { ∅ })|(# ` hs0)[≤]2 }), c2 ∈ UPGraph)
  upgrf(hs0, c2, c4, (Vtx ` c2))
  eqid((Vtx ` c2))

  eqcomd(c5, (Vtx ` c2), w0)
  feq123d((iEdg ` c0), dom((iEdg ` c0)), { hs0 ∈ P((Vtx ` c0))|(# ` hs0)= 2 }, (c3 ⋃ c4), (dom(c3)⋃ dom(c4)), { hs0 ∈ P(c5)|(# ` hs0)= 2 }, w0)
  syl6eq(dom((iEdg ` c0)), (dom(c3)⋃ dom(c4)), dom((c3 ⋃ c4)), w0)

  pweqd((Vtx ` c0), c5, w0)

  isumgrs(hs0, c0, c6, (iEdg ` c0), (Vtx ` c0))

  diff.hs0.c(P((Vtx ` c2)))
